com.projetloki.genesis

Class Shadow

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.Shadow

  • @PoorBrowserSupport
public final class Shadow
extends Object
    A shadow to add to a text or a box. Example: 
     Properties props = Properties.builder()
     .setColor(Color.RED)
     .setTextShadow(
         Shadow.offsetPx(1, 1)
             .blurPx(2)
             .color(Color.BLACK),
         Shadow.offsetPx(0, 0)
             .blurEm(1)
             .color(Color.BLUE))
     .build();

    Some properties of shadow only apply to boxes. When the shadow is applied to a text, such properties are ignored and don't figure in the generated CSS code.

    Shadows are immutable. Methods such as blurPx(int) perform a copy of the instance they are called on, modify the copy and return it. The original instance is left unchanged.

    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    text-shadow examples (MDN), box-shadow examples (MDN), Browser support (text shadows), Browser support (box shadows)

    • Method Detail

      • offsetPx

        public static Shadow offsetPx(int xOffsetPx,
              int yOffsetPx)
        Returns a new shadow with the given offset, specified in pixels. Negative values place the shadow to the left of/above the element. The blur radius and the spread radius are both zero, and the color is the color of the text for text shadows, and depends on the browser for box shadows.

      • offsetEm

        public static Shadow offsetEm(double xOffsetEm,
              double yOffsetEm)
        Returns a new shadow with the given offset, specified in pixels. Negative values place the shadow to the left of/above the element. The blur radius and the spread radius are both zero, and the color is the color of the text for text shadows, and depends on the browser for box shadows.

      • blurPx

        public Shadow blurPx(int blurPx)
        Returns a shadow that is similar to this, with the blur radius property set to the given length. Specified in pixels. The larger the length, the bigger the blur, so the shadow becomes bigger and lighter. Negative values are not allowed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length is negative

      • blurPx

        public Shadow blurPx(double blurEm)
        Returns a shadow that is similar to this, with the blur radius property set to the given length. Specified in ems. The larger the length, the bigger the blur, so the shadow becomes bigger and lighter. Negative values are not allowed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length is negative

      • spreadPx

        public Shadow spreadPx(int spreadPx)
        Returns a new shadow similar to this, with the spread radius property set to the given length. Specified in pixels. Positive values will cause the shadow to expand and grow bigger, negative values will cause the shadow to shrink.

        Only applies to box shadows.

      • spreadPx

        public Shadow spreadPx(double spreadEm)
        Returns a new shadow similar to this, with the spread radius property set to the given length. Specified in ems. Positive values will cause the shadow to expand and grow bigger, negative values will cause the shadow to shrink.

        Only applies to box shadows.

      • color

        public Shadow color(Color color)
        Returns a new shadow similar to this, with the color property set to the given color.

      • inset

        public Shadow inset()
        Returns a new shadow similar to this, with the inset property. Inset shadows are drawn inside the border (even transparent ones), above the background, but below content.

        Only applies to box shadows.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Overrides:
